name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
2 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Very pleased with this place, would stay here again. Calyn is a very responsive host, replied to inquiries promptly. Gave us a refund of the cleaning fee after we found linens and towels in the washer and dryer when we arrived (we finished washing them and put them away). Speaking of which, the washer and dryer worked great, very helpful in the middle of our trip. Nice kitchen, large living room. Great location, easy walk to Ithaca Commons. A few minuses: The bathroom was off the living room instead of the bedroom, so from the bedroom you have to walk through the kitchen and living room to get to the bathroom. Parking on Linn St. was available, but a little tight sometimes.

February 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cascadilla Flat is in a great location - very walkable to restaurants, shops and a couple of the nearby waterfalls. The decor is also very well curated and inviting. Overall, it was good for the price and for a short stay. However, there were a few things that could be improved. The place was only "kind of" clean when we arrived - in that it seemed like the last guest(s) followed the check out cleaning instructions (which were kind of a lot considering the cleaning fee) and the cleaner only replaced the linens and completed a cursory wipe-down of the bathroom. There wasn't a shower head, which was a little odd since it's been mentioned as an issue in previous reviews from several months ago. Lastly, it was quite cold even with the space heater and provided blanket (which smelled as if it hadn't been washed in awhile).

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Calyn’s listing is in a super convenient and walkable location, close to the Ithaca Commons and nature alike! The space was a bit more run down than expected unfortunately—peeling & cracking walls, older building feel, odd shower head. Be prepared to walk up a flight of stairs with your luggage. It’s well kept in the sense that the listing’s description is accurate and it’s not dirty, but it feels less comfortable than we would have hoped. Great for a shorter stay. If we were there more than a few days, I think these issues would have been a bigger deal. But can’t beat the convenience!

·
Stayed one night
review_text: Cascadilla Flat is clean, sunny and bright, and decorated charmingly. If you’re looking for the hotel experience this isn’t it, as it’s dated but it’s all about the location. When we arrived we walked the Cascadilla glen trail up to Collegetown and Cornell’s campus, then returned for an evening meal on Ithaca Commons. Calyn provides delicious coffee and a French press so we were fueled up for a walk in the Plantations before we headed home. My husband thought the nightly rate was high but he hasn’t seen the Ithaca hotel rates!! I would definitely return.

review_text: An idyllic space in Ithaca close to downtown and right next door to Cascadilla Gorge. The couch, which folds out, and bed are comfy and the space fits three guests fine. It's compact, the kitchen is fairly small, and it's up a flight of stairs, but otherwise the space is accommodating. Airy and peaceful. Simple check in and out too. review_text:
Really lovely historical building and great location. Quaint space with nice art and a welcoming vintage vibe. Good location for walking to downtown or the gorge hike around the corner.
Would have liked a heads up specifically that the heat is controlled by the downstairs tenant—we didn’t read the little binder of info until the morning—I lived in Ithaca so didn’t think I needed to read the suggestions booklet. We assumed the mechanism with a vent and a knob for low, med, high in the kitchen controlled the heat. We turned it on before we went to sleep—-I’m guessing now it was just a fan. Woke up to a very chilly house. Thankfully it was warm the day before.
Walked into the bathroom to find lots of different people’s hair on the bathroom floor and bathroom sink/counter. That was a little off-putting. But everything else seemed clean?
Sorry to say this, but it wasn’t worth the price by half. We stayed at the Argos Inn for the same price as this rental the next night. Same price after taxes and cleaning fee.
The housing market, am I right?

There were some issues at the start of my stay that Calyn immediately tried to address; unfortunately, some just weren’t able to be resolved during my visit, and I’m not sure ultimately about the value of the price I paid versus the experience I had, but I still enjoyed my time there and think it’s a great choice for a stay in Ithaca.

cascadilla flat is a wonderful, bright unit very close to everything in ithaca! tons of natural light made it a very aesthetically pleasing place during the day. there's not a lot of lighting at night, so it does get a little dim, but that just made it easier to go to sleep. a very short walk to downtown/the Commons, and a beautiful walk (with many stairs) to the Cornell campus.
parking was street parking only but we didn't have any issues with this during a 1-week stay. Calyn is very responsive and her guidebook was really helpful!

name: Susan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: If you want to experience what it's like to live in one of the older homes in the historic district of downtown Ithaca, then the Cascadilla Flat is the place for you. The location is excellent. It's walking distance to the Ithaca Commons but yet on a quiet street with lovely homes. It's located just across the street frm the Cascadilla Falls trail head and Cornell University is right up the hill. It's a big hill but that is Ithaca. The Cascadilla Falls trail is so gorgeous, you hardly feel the hill. We loved the whole vibe of the house and the Flat. The vibe is thoughtful, creative, and original. Staying at Cascadilla Flat is a much more unique experience than staying in a hotel room and we enjoyed the extra space of the common area as we were visiting our son at college and it was fun to have a pizza dinner with him on Friday night when we came in and coffee and pastries with him on Sunday morning before we left. I highly recommend Thompson and Bleeker for wood fired pizza and Gimme Coffee for locally roasted coffee and pastries...all walking distance from the Cascadilla Flat. I loved the window seat that overlooked the street. The apartment was only about 4.5 miles away from the Robert Treman State Park. We enjoyed an amazing hike to Lucifer Falls. The parking at the Flat is street parking but it was free on Saturday and Sundays and it was easy to find a spot and there is a garage nearby if needed. You do have to climb two flights of stairs: one to get into the house and the other to get to the second floor. So, if stairs are a concern, then this might not be the house for you. We hope to stay at the Cascadilla Flat again. It was a relaxing and fun experience.

Unfortunately we had to leave early due to illness and after reaching out to Calyn and requesting a refund for 1 nights stay, she ghosted us. Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The cabin was very comfortable and cozy. When we saw that the temperature was dropping, we were concerned about being cold, but Heather and Jeremy have provided everything needed to stay nice and warm--lots of blankets and comforters and robes. But it turned out that the radiant heating that keeps the floor warm was almost all we needed.
We brought food we'd prepared at home, and the kitchen had all the tools and dishware we needed, plus tea and coffee. After going out to Moosewood for our daughter's birthday, we all came back and had a pleasant celebration with cake at the cabin.
The setting was relaxed, just what we needed, and we spent a lot of time being lazy. Heather and Jeremy provided clear instructions for everything. We didn't really need to get in touch with them during the stay, but we felt confident that they would have been helpful if we had been looking for recommendations or had encountered any problems.
We'd gladly come back during another season.

review_text: Our stay was everything we were hoping for and more. Private and pristine, we loved the cozy ambience and the beautiful natural environment. Heather and Jeremy have thought of everything: from teas and coffees to extra bathroom supplies .. perfect if you forgot something on your trip. One small thing to note is that there is not a lot of open surface area to lay put your personal travel items. Not a problem if you're traveling lightly and don't have much stuff; we were on a longer road trip hence had more items and didn't really have much room to lay things out except on the floor. But other than that, it was great; if we're ever in the Ithaca area again we'd certainly stay here again: it's so close to all the amazing activities Ithaca has to offer and very comfortable. Thank you both again!

review_text:
This was my first experience renting an Airbnb. The “cabin” is amazing, and Heather is an incredible host! She is quick to respond to any inquiries before and during your stay, and she has thought of, and makes available, virtually anything you may have forgotten to pack, seriously! Oh…there is also the bonus of having an Empire pass available to get into all of the state parks, which was the main purpose of my trip!
This was my first time back to Ithaca in 23 years, and I needed it to be extra special. Spending two days here was all that, and so much more. It is quiet, peaceful, and beautiful…the perfect place to unplug, unwind, and reflect on the good things in life. I really cannot say enough good things about this experience. So, thank you, Heather, for a memorable stay in my happiest place on earth. I am returning home with a lighter heart and a smile.
Shelly S.

Stayed one night
review_text:
This is a tricky review to write. The place offered was exactly as described, but the experience of being there was not at all the relaxed getaway we dreamed of. We have stayed at many wonderful Airbnbs and none have felt as oppressive and particular in their expectations as this one. We are two responsible adults who understand the idea of treating someone else’s home with respect, but the intense list of rules/expectations/threats felt much more like staying at a strict grandma’s house than a retreat.
It is a beautiful, promising property and, with some tweaks, could really be a great place to enjoy.
Oh! Very important to note: the semi-sheer front and back door curtains do not allow full privacy!

Also, notice there is no TV listed. We should have picked up on that because it was not mentioned in the description, i guess we just assume places all have TV and Netflix etc… would be a good touch for this place as we missed having that.
Otherwise lovely stay and good value. Very clean.

name: Nicole
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We loved Julie’s place. Everything was really well organized and thought out. Julie is clearly a very conscientious person who put a lot of effort into her place. She was great with communication and letting us know her expectations. We couldn’t have asked for a better host. The bedroom had nice darkening shades so we got great sleep, the mattress was comfortable, and the kitchen/living room was awesome to hang out in with plenty of spots to sit, read, eat, do yoga, and work. Every morning my husband I did some yoga on our mats, then made breakfast (really appreciated the toaster oven and electric water kettle- thank you Julie!!), walked to Gimme for coffee, and took some time to read or talk. We spent the afternoons on long walks and spent the evenings in watching movies on our laptop. We knew there wasn’t a tv so we brought a laptop and it worked out great. The connection was perfect. We also brought our own rice machine for dinners. In general, the kitchen was fully stocked and we found everything we needed. My husband really loved that aspect. We also brought a microwave popcorn kettle for fresh popcorn which was an awesome addition to our weekend. My husband and I always bring our own pillows and blanket on trips but Julie’s bedding was very nice. Our blanket came in handy to put between our bodies and the mattress as there was a plastic cover beneath the fitted sheet that made for some really sweaty sleep the first night. After we put our blanket down under us, we were incredibly comfortable.

name: Christopher
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2020
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
My first Airbnb during the coronavirus pandemic, and I felt some trepidation at traveling, but Julie has made her place feel very safe. Contact-free check-in, everything spotless, and plentiful disinfectants / cleaners for guests' use. WiFi is solid — 100 Mbps; the router is in the bedroom and not shared with anyone else. Washer+dryer was nice to have; small but they work great.
It's the little things that really get me sometimes. I like being able to see where all my stuff is (without having to learn/remember which drawer I put what) and not be all over the floor, for which wall/door hooks are invaluable. Well, Julie's place has hooks. So many hooks. (And drawers, if you're into that.) Love it :)
The kitchen is very well-furnished, and again, the little things add up: sharp knives, unscratched non-stick pans, good towels, plenty of utensils, multiple coffee-making options, lots of counter space, and a useful swath of basic cooking staples.

Rating, 4 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The location was great and the house was mostly as described but definitely not as nice as it looked in the photos. They don't show a picture of the shower downstairs, which seems deliberate, b/c the shower walls were yellowed.
The kitchen was well-stocked, but the nonstick cookware was quite scratched up and the dish scrub looked quite worn.
Additionally, they locked the thermostat--I was unable to keep it at 72 degrees consistently without having to message them. They were also slow to respond--it took over five hours for the host to respond. They turned it up to 72 degrees but did not give me the passcode, which felt weird to me.
The upstairs bedroom with the blue floors looked aesthetic but was poorly insulated and furnished. The pillows were flat, the only blankets were thin quilts despite it being winter, and I could hear the street noise. It was also significantly colder than carpeted bedroom.
Overall, this was a decent stay, but I definitely expected more for the price.

Had a great one-night stay at David's place. My brother and I went to an event at nearby Cornell University. It was my brother's first time in an Airbnb and I told him that this place is a "perfect" example of one, where everything is as expected.
It was clean and comfortable, and all the amenities we needed, like towels and bedding, were amply supplied. The apartment was decorated but no clutter which was nice. The bedrooms were spacious, my preferred temperature and dark It was easy to get into and find. David was communicative and clear about details, including parking (we parked on the street instead of in the space based on his information). We got some great breakfast place recommendations. And, the chocolates were a nice touch.
We felt at home!
One note for future guests is that the stairs going up to the bedrooms are steep. It was no problem at all for us (we are both in our late 50s) but might be a consideration for other.s
Highly recommen

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Rented for my thirtieth birthday. Wasn't bad, but first night we received a noise complaint while playing board games, so that was surprising. Everyone was very cold Friday night, and we were unable to turn up the thermostat as it was locked. George came to the unit Saturday afternoon to fix the thermostat. I asked if there were more paper towels, and they were locked up. George made a comment about it smelling like bacon and reminded us to use the fan when cooking. We did use the fan, and I felt like he was looking around checking up on us instead of letting us relax. He left and then came back a second time to mess with the thermostat again. I've stayed in many air bnbs and have never had a host interrupt our stay, have so many rules, or bother us the way we were on this trip. This aside, it is a good location and okay house, but the owners should work on releasing control and being a little more accommodating to guests.

review_text: My daughter and I stayed at David’s place to look at Ithaca College for the weekend. I love the pictures he posted online but it is definitely cuter in person. The kitchen was very large and he had all the makings for coffee with explicit details on how to use his coffee machine. He had spices and condiments that made my life so much easier. The beds were comfortable and the bedrooms were very spacious which was a plus. I never felt crammed being there. He had all the extras you could imagine….tissues, paper towels, laundry items, beautiful towels, hand towels, shampoo, conditioner, books to read, games to play etc. there are too many to list. The place is definitely walkable to the Commons but it happened to be cold and snowy so we stayed in one night and cooked and ate at the Ale House the other night which was good as well. I really have no complaints. If my daughter decides on Ithaca College then I will definitely stay there again for sure.

Thanks for the late check out and for being a true Super Host. (From one to another!). You are the epitome of what is right with the home vacation rental industry.

Stayed over a week
review_text: Location couldn’t have been better - no need for a car, as house is within walking distance to all the local “hotspots”- restaurants, bars, breweries, shopping, pharmacy, grocery store. We walked to all easily. Beds so comfortable, bathrooms very large with lots of storage, huge laundry room, fully stocked kitchen. I was able to cook lunch for the Cornell football offensive line with ease and entertain them in the lovely kitchen dining area. The outside seating was perfect for coffee/happy hour. The extra sitting room was perfect when my husband needed to work, thanks to the nice desk setup. Our family of 5 was able to meet up each afternoon (only 4 of us slept there) in the living room to watch football on the huge TV. Such a comfortable couch and chairs! We met all the neighbors and felt so safe in the quaint little neighborhood. Parking was available and easy. Overall, amazing stay!!!!

In short, this home has everything that is needed and it is all convenient. The neighborhood is lovely and all Ithaca has to offer is accessible.

For example, the TV is very nice vs budget models that we've seen too often elsewhere. There is great lighting throughout. The street is very quiet. Easy walking distance to many places, and a short drive from everything. We traveled with our two young daughters and walked to the local library almost every day which had an amazing kids section. And George is a great host: responsive and helpful. We can't wait to visit Ithaca again, and hope David's place is available!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
First off, I'm an anxious person who worries about the small things... David/George was right there guiding me through every step of the check-in process. I had sent George a message regarding things to see and places to eat... All incredible suggestions. The location of the house couldn't be better! Everything was a 2-3min drive. Yes, we drove because walking in 98 degrees in July isn't fun. Wegman's grocery store is open late; we were able to pick up snacks before our waterfall chasing hikes. It's probably the best grocery store I've ever been to!
The beds were marvelous (memory foam!!!) and the AC Unit saved us from sweating to death. Every single detail of this home was perfect for us. 2 bathrooms weren't needed, but it sure was convenient when we had to rush to use it from a 3 hour long hike! There are guidebooks, tour pamphlets and their own AirBnB guide. I never felt anxious or uneasy staying here. We were able to relax and enjoy ourselves on the couch to watch some Netflix and make an espresso in the morning.
I would love to stay here again! Thanks for everything!

name: Melis

February 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
David's home is super cute and homey. The location is perfect—just 4 minutes from Ithaca bakery and a quick walk to Hawi Ethiopian (two of our favorite stops in Ithaca). No one else was in the attached in-law suite when we stayed, so it was super quiet, private, and enjoyable. I especially appreciated the design of the front bedroom upstairs. It felt like a creative space, so I worked from bed instead of on the desk. However, there is a lovely desk and reading nook at the bottom of the staircase that my husband enjoyed.
We stayed on a pretty cold night and were warm and toasty. We've stayed in plenty of older homes that tend to be drafty, but this place is well insulated, and everything is functioning just as it should. David even changed the thermostat cap remotely at my request to make sure we were comfortable. I appreciated his responsiveness from the booking through to checkout.
Extra perk: I loved that this home was super clean yet didn't smell of cleaning solution or fragrances. Sometimes Airbnbs use a lot of Febreeze, plug-in air fresheners, or scented detergents. I'm really sensitive to these things, so it can make a stay unpleasant. But David's place was perfect for anyone like me with allergies and sensitivities!
Note on parking: I was a little concerned when I heard about the driveway being challenging to get in/out of since we had two cars with us, but we found street parking directly in front of the home, so that wasn't an issue.
Thank you so much, David! We'll definitely stay again the next time we're in town.

Our stay was 6 nights and was perfect for 2 couples in town for a wedding. It's on a quiet street with comfortable beds to ensure you're well rested to take in all that Ithaca has to offer. I'd highly recommend David's place!
As a side note, unrelated to these accommodations, if you are travelling to Ithaca any time soon, be prepared for long waits and early closures at local eateries. This once bustling downtown had noticeably fewer dining options and was shuttered by 4 p.m. on Labor Day so plan ahead!

review_text: The home was great but not 100% what we expected. It was small and comfortable, the only thing we had difficulty with was adjusting to all the bugs. There were spiders and big ants everywhere and some bugs that were flying around. Could not find any holes or cracks which made us a little more anxious. The house was very clean and well kept which made it more confusing. Thankfully no bugs that could cause harm in any of the furnitures. David was a great host and came to help right away by cleaning the whole house and even offering a service to come check the house regarding the bugs. He was a great help and I appreciate everything he did for us.

We have stayed at a few AirBnBs in Ithaca over the last year and this is hands down the best one we've experienced! It has every amenity you could imagine to make for a comfortable stay, plus some lovely touches left by the hosts. The beds are comfortable, the kitchen is well appointed, the whole place was spotless, and the apartment is so beautifully designed and furnished. Also, the location is great - you can easily walk to all of the shops, restaurants and cafes downtown and it's also a very short drive to both colleges and other nearby spots of interest. We were only there for a couple of days but will definitely be back for another stay in the near future.

For anyone interested in visiting a student at Ithaca College or Cornell, this puts you within a five-minute drive of either (or a manageable walk—but of course be prepared for a steep climb!). The hosts are very friendly and came to the rescue with a brand-new flashlight and extra candles when a citywide power outage hit following storms. You’ll find yourself mere blocks from a range of good restaurants (be sure to check out the Rook, which is a real gem away from Ithaca Commons). We will watch for availability here on future Ithaca trips.

name: Jules
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Isabel and Zac’s home was beautiful and we really enjoyed our stay. It is closed to everything. Was able to walk up the hill to Cornell and the Ithaca Commons is only a few blocks away. Also near a bus stop which can take you to/from airport which is more reliable than Uber/lyft which can be difficult to find sometimes.
The loft is beautiful and great for working. If you use as a bedroom you must bring an eye mask for sleeping as there is an uncovered skylight and light pours in early. They were kind enough to leave some snacks, OJ, coffee, tea and oat nut creamer along with eggs and pancakes. I thought that was a really warm and welcoming touch. It was bit hot upstairs in the loft and hard to regulate the heat but that may have been user error. They ask you to strip the sheets and take out the trash which was fine but I’d never been asked to do that by a host before.
Overall a really great stay and we would define you stay there again when in Ithaca.

name: Cathy

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Isabel and Zac always responded to my messages quickly. On our drive to Ithaca my husband developed a migraine and we were to arrive 4 hours before check in. I messaged and explained our situation. They contacted the cleaning company and we were able to get in 2 hours early … the blinds drawn in the bedroom and ready for him to lie down. The home was bright and cheery with fresh flowers and welcoming treats. We truly enjoyed our time here. We were able to walk to the falls to hike and also walked down town for food. We met Zac and he was extremely kind and friendly. 10/10 would recommend.

Had a great time and wish we had stayed longer to be able to drive around Seneca Lake. We did drive around Cayuga lake and saw many of the incredible waterfalls within minutes of the house. Visited some ciders and wineries. So many to choose from. Great place!

Very nice apartment. Great amenities. Quality appliances, etc. Good shower. Well stocked. Warm, comfortable bed. Good location.
One note, there are no shades on the 3 main windows. As you can see by the photos, it's one big living space so not having any shades creates a privacy issue.
Communication was good up until several days before arrival. They were traveling at the time, but it would be helpful to have some back-up in place for when they are away. Communication was good otherwise.
Overall, it's a very nice comfortable apartment in good proximity to the Ithaca Commons, restaurants, waterfalls, hiking, and both Seneca and Cayuga Lakes for visiting wineries.
Highly recommend.

It's 3 or 4 blocks away from Ithaca Commons (the downtown pedestrian shopping district), making it extremely walkable, yet located on a quiet street. The description of this listing is spot on. The pictures are very accurate. What stood out for me was the amazing attention to detail in terms of cleanliness... like seriously, you guys, this place was clean, and I'm an insane neat freak. Final bonus: there's a Nespresso (so clean I actually used it and I NEVER feel comfortable enough to use the coffee machine in a rental!). Really one of the best airbnb stays I've ever experienced.

review_text: Our son was getting married in Ithaca on Oct. 1st and we needed a large house to rent for 6 days to host our immediate family on both sides. We ended up renting the Chic Mansion AND the Carriage House. Can not even begin to say enough about how great our stay was. Both places are beautiful, clean, extremely cozy and in a GREAT location - walkable to the Commons, breweries, restaurants and even hiking trails. We had 9 people just in the Chic Mansion and we still had plenty of room and privacy for everyone. It was also a great gathering place for other friends and family who attended the wedding. Isabel was very responsive to all of our questions and made sure our stay was as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. I would HIGHLY recommend renting either place (or both!). Do not think you will find a better location or better accommodations in Ithaca. Thank you Isabel & Zac!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A wonderful stay! Isabel & Zac have created the perfect coach house oasis tucked back a couple of blocks from the pedestrian-only Ithaca Commons.
My wife and I very much enjoyed our stay while visiting our son in college. It was a quick drive to the Cornell and Ithaca College campuses, and centrally located for everything else Ithaca has to offer.
The high ceilings provide a light, airy feeling and high windows bring in plenty of natural light. The decor is spot on with a comfortable, yet appropriately impersonal feel. That said, the few knick knacks and books were interesting and added to the experience.
Everything was spotless and clean, and the kitchen was fully stocked with cooking equipment, pots, pans, knives, etc.
Check in was a breeze, and parking was just outside front door.
We look forward to a return visit

After that first night, were able to park in the driveway. Other than these glitches, a very nice stay. Super comfy beds, nice towels, an easy walk to the Commons, light streaming in, and a real kitchen. It’s a beautiful space the owners have a right to be proud of.

I came to town to support my mother through some medical needs, and being able to land, rest and restore in their carriage house was a wonderful support and balm. They have done an amazing job at creating an urban retreat in the city. Communication was very fluid and everything was as I imagined it would be from the description. I would certainly stay there again in the future!

The hot water tank actually malfunctioned during our stay! The water gradually got colder while we were showering until it became freezing cold.
However, Isabel & Zac were super responsive and arrived within 20 minutes to help. There was a temporary solution for the night and Zac came back early the next day to completely fix the hot water tank.
We are so thankful for all their helpful.
Despite this missing hot water (freezing in the shower) situation, this Airbnb will definitely be our top choice in Ithaca and we would love to return to stay here! My girlfriend and I work in NYC and this Airbnb is just the perfect getaway. So conveniently located, cozy, and beautifully designed.

Isabel & Zac thought of everything here to make for a comfortable stay (as an Airbnb host myself, I'm taking away a few ideas :). The beds were exceptionally comfortable (haven't slept that well in weeks!) and the setting is very peaceful. Sparkling clean, full kitchen and convenient coffee pods, little games and great books. Can't wait to visit again!

review_text:
Isabel & Zac's space is wonderful; so clean and thoughtful! It has everything you need. My only regret is that I wasn't staying longer to cook in the kitchen, it's fantastic!
My best friend and I enjoyed short drives (20 minutes and 30 minutes) to hike Lucifer Falls and wine tasting right on Lake Cayuga at the Twisted Owl Winery. Every place else in town, we walked! It's so close to great restaurants, local bars and shops. If you're a record collector, make sure you check out Angry Mom Records in the basement of the local used bookstore.
We seriously couldn't have asked a more beautiful space in a more perfect location. This is a must stay place if you are visiting Ithaca :)

name: Kathleen
rating_info:

,
·
June 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Location is excellent. About a 7-minute walk to Downtown Commons. You'll spend more time driving there and trying to find a place to park than just walking. Isabel and Zac went out of their way to make us welcome; I mentioned that we were bringing our two young children (ages 7 and 10) and our hosts went out and purchased new toys and games for them to enjoy during our stay. Do the big stuff like hiking Buttermilk and Taughannock and Treman parks and going to the Sciencenter, but also enjoy some simple pleasures like the Alex Haley community pool (a 15-minute walk), the public library (4-minute walk), and the sprayground in Stewark Park. The space was comfortable with lots of thoughtful details (condiments, laundry detergent, a fan for the bedroom, multiple snacks at check in, etc. The layout of the "living room" is a little cramped; we weren't really able to cozy up on the couch and watch TV at the end of the day, but no big deal. Wifi was a bit spotty as well. Otherwise, our kids declared it one of their favorite spots of all our family vacations.

We are grateful to our hosts and hope to visit again!

review_text: This was a perfect stay. A lovely attic apartment in an older house near downtown Ithaca, this space as been beautifully updated with modern touches. It's very comfortable and squeaky clean. Bed is super comfortable. Bathroom is cute and clean, kitchen is lovely. Fun features throughout the apartment. Quiet residential area, walkable to downtown Ithaca and a quick drive to places like the farmers market or Cornell campus. Plenty of parking. Hosts were responsive and helpful. Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended. A+

name: Janet

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Katherine and Jia are excellent hosts. Their place was perfect for my two nights in Ithaca. I had messaged them prior to booking, and asked questions about the location in relation to places I wanted to see while there. They answered very quickly and with detailed descriptions of walking distances as well as the conditions of the routes. I had hoped to walk to the Cornell botanical gardens, and they let me know it was walkable, but uphill all the way, so I was well prepared! They also recommended restaurants with vegan options (Lev Kitchen is excellent) and because I wanted to try the local cideries, they had great suggestions for those. The apartment was so clean and welcoming, very well stocked and organized and with detailed instructions for everything. And a claw foot tub! 🛁 The neighborhood is lovely for walking, and close to Ithaca falls. The bed is very comfortable and the linens are fresh and clean. I’ve stayed in several Airbnb’s and this is one of my favorites.

The entire space was absolutely spotless, and tastefully decorated. We were thrilled with the thoughtful amenities provided, including the bathroom toiletries in lovely glass containers, the coffee and tea tray with mugs, and the abundance of kitchen supplies to use (in a very spacious kitchen perfect for cooking!). The bed was clean and very comfortable. The location is ideal for walking to shops, coffee, waterfalls, and more. Lastly, Katherine and Jia provide a cheery and detailed note to guide your stay, including instructions for the Airbnb and suggestions for around town.
Don't hesitate to book.

We loved our stay in Ithaca! The location over Katherine and Jia’s place is perfect - just enough away from downtown to not be too noisy, but close enough to walk. It’s a great neighborhood to walk around, and felt very safe. Ithaca Falls is right around the corner, too.
The apartment itself is very comfy and cozy, with nice little stylistic touches. We were so thankful that they allow dogs! There isn’t a fenced in area, but there is a small area in back to take your furry friend out for a quick break. (P.s. my wife and I wanted to get out our gardening tools and make the backyard a cool little hang spot - so much potential! :)
Thanks for a great stay! I definitely recommend it!

name: Judy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
It is a pleasure to look back on our month long stay at this AirBnB.
It was a real "home away from home" and hits the high marks for all categories.
Communication: Excellent via the AirBnB platform before and during our stay. Jia was on site weekly (and lives nearby) to take care of the physical property and prepare the downstairs unit for short term guests.
Location: Perfect! Close to Ithaca Falls, downtown, (The Commons, Dewitt Park Collegetown bagels:), Stewart Park, Farmer's Market , Cascadilla Gorge and Cornell.
Amenities: Remodeled kitchen which was well appointed (and marked for easy to find locations), fun clawfoot bathtub, good hot water/shower, and comfortable bed. We had a friend stay overnight on the pull out couch and she reported it as being spacious and comfortable. The hosts provided plenty of sheets, bedding, towels, etc. for the unit. We suggest you bring your own towels if you go swimming in lakes & gorges, as the towels are white.
We were able to access the on site laundry room since we stayed a month. That was a real plus too.
It was a pleasure to meet Jia and some of the other guests and neighbors. The neighborhood felt very safe.
We had a great stay and would recommend this oasis in Fall Creek to other Ithaca travelers without hesitation.
Thank you Jia and Katherine. See you next year!

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed over a week
review_text:
This is everything you could want out of an AirBnB. My girlfriend and I stayed at Katherine and Gia's apartment for 5 weeks. Two of them, we were quarantined for two weeks due to NY travel restrictions and were not allowed to leave the property. For the two of us, the space had ample room, work spaces, and a spacious kitchen. The apartment was extremely clean. The kitchen was labeled and had plenty of tools to cook and bake to our hearts content.
The pictures don't do a great job of showing off the living room which has a comfortable couch and coffee table. Overall, apartment was a bit more spacious than we expected and extremely comfortable.
Downtown is about a 10-15 minute walk away and you're very close to other attractions like Ithaca Falls, the Cascadilla Gorge Trail, and Cornell University. The town is extremely cute and filled with shops and restaurants. The farmers market is a must if you visit.
Only thing to know is that the only doors are in on bathroom and the door to the apartment so don't expect a ton of privacy from your traveling companions.

I highly recommend staying here. The hosts are responsive and friendly and the apartment is wonderful, and the town is worth visiting.

review_text: This place was great! I would definitely stay here again. It is several blocks from the commons, walking distance to Ithaca falls and the farmers market. Parking was easy. And a lot of little touches, such as ample towels and toilet paper, good shampoo and conditioner and soap in the shower, coffee and tea, a welcome book, little chocolates, ports and cords to charge phones. Storage areas were labeled which made it convenient and easy. The clawfoot tub was very special. The apartment is bigger than it looks in the pictures. And there are lots of convenient places to store your clothes and such. The apartment was much bigger in person than it looks in the photos. Everything was very comfortable and immaculate.

review_text: This apartment is absolutely lovely, stylish, well-organized, and has many thoughtful touches. Check in is super easy, just a lockbox. There’s a binder full of local recommendations, everything is sparkling clean. All the drawers in the kitchen are marked so you don’t have to go searching for anything. A/c is good; the house is in some shade so it doesn’t get too hot to begin with. It’s in a very cute residential neighborhood with easy parking. Will definitely try to snag this place again, they really put a lot of effort into making it a welcoming place. Best Airbnb experience I’ve had.

Katherine & Jia are also wonderful communicators—any question or comment was promptly met with guidance or a reply (they’re very nice folks, too!) Our family of five (three humans, two pets) loved our stay!

review_text: We LOVED this Airbnb! This is everything we hoped for and more. It was cute, clean, and cozy. The bed was very comfortable, and the shower had great water pressure. For a little studio, it had a great sized bathroom. Absolutely STUNNING views out the windows of trees and the gorge. We didn't get a chance to use the communal space downstairs, but we hope to next time. We will 100% be staying here again — thank you, Tim!

review_text: Our stay at this studio on the gorge was amazing! The interior of the studio was decorated wonderfully, spotless, and had every amenity you could expect of a studio apartment. The view off of the deck was wonderful and waking up to the lush trees right outside our window was amazing. The apartment felt like it was situated in the middle of the woods, yet it was a quick 10 minute walk from so many restaurants, shops, and more! Tim was wonderfully responsive and had amazing recommendations. We will definitely be returning and certainly recommend this stay!

review_text: really nice space that's a short walk or super quick drive from the Ithaca Commons, so we had lots of restaurant options, and then a convenient drive to state parks, breweries/wineries, lakes, etc, which is why we stayed here! there is no A/C and it was a bit hot during the day, but we kept the sliding door open which cooled off the place really nicely, and was so peaceful with the river below! I loved sitting on the balcony with the trees surrounding me, it was a great escape from the city. and Tim had a really detailed list of recommendations which I appreciated :)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The studio is beautifully designed and maintained. It's in a truly lovely spot that makes you feel like you're in a treehouse. Waking up to all that green was delightful and with the state of the art bathroom, comfortable bed and kitchenette, you really do have everything you need. The location is great: about a walkable mile (5 minute drive) to the Ithaca Commons where there are bars, restaurants and shops galore to stroll around and soak up the positive Ithaca vibes. The communication was Tim was great. The space is quite small and is in the back of a house that has other apartments in it; if you're looking for more privacy, this may not be the right Airbnb, but we felt we got an authentic feel for life in this lovely college town.
